headline.main: Municipalities Considered as the Bulwarks of Public Liberty.

docs.lead_paragraph: The address of the Mayor and Common Council to the people of the State of NewYork, in reference to the alleged oppression of the City by the Legislature, contains a large portion of the political capital with which the Wood Party in the Democracy proposes to use an English electioneering phrase--" to go to the country."

headline.main: American Board of Commissioners for Foreign Missions.; SECOND DAY--AFTERNOON.

docs.lead_paragraph: The session for this afternoon was unusualy short. The crowded state of the house at the hour of assembling, together with the increasing heat of the weather, rendered the andience impatient. After an hour or more had been spent in addresses these tokens were wisely taken into account, and an early motion of adjournment was moved and passed without dissent.

headline.main: VERY LATE FROM-UTAH.; Arrival of Mormon Elders from Great Salt Lake City--Four Thousand Mormon Immigrants on the Plains---A Bountifal Harvest---The Mormon Temple. & c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Yesterday, we had the pleasure of an interview with Elder SAMUEL W. RICHARDS, of Utah, who arrived in this City on thursday evening, after the remarkably short trip of twenty-eight days from Great Salt Lake City. Our dates from Utah by this arrival reach to the 13th of August. Elder RICHARDS left Salt Lake City in company with four others.

docs.lead_paragraph: QUARANTINE MATTER.--The steamship Illinois was yesterday discharged from Quarantine, and she came up last evening, and went to Hunter's Point to go upon the ways for repair. She has been perfectly freed from all impurities, and is pronounced by the Health Officer perfectly free from infection.

docs.lead_paragraph: The counterfeiting g ntry are getting decidedly bold, but if the Metropolitan Officers continue as vigilant as they have been the community will not suffer much. Yesterday we gave an account of the arrest of ten or eleven persons for attempting to pass counterfeit threes on the Hudson County Bank, of New. Jersey. Since then more arrests have been made.

headline.main: The Democratic Convention at Syracuse.; PROBABLE CANDIDATES. HOW THE DIFFICULTIES WILL BE SETTLED, Gathering of Delegates--LAck of Excitement. The Multiplicity of Delegations from New-York.

docs.lead_paragraph: Judge Bailhache, a venerable citizen of Illinois, died on the 22d inst. from the effects of the injuries he received, by being thrown from a carriage at Alton on the 1st inst. Judge Bailhache was one of the moat widely known and respected citizens of the State.

docs.lead_paragraph: QUARANTINE MATTERS.-There was no fresh cases of disease at Quarantine yesterday, inside or outside of the walls, and the surviving patients from the Illinois were doing well There was one exoeption only, to this, who would probably die, making six deaths out of the whole number landed from that steamer.

docs.lead_paragraph: The official report from Quarantine, yesterday, was very favorable as respects the condition of the yellow-fever patients from the steamer Illinois. With the exception of one case which may prove fatal, all the remaining cases were improving, and would recover.
